q: chief executive in a surprising management reshuffling announced with the Internet company's fourth-quarter earnings, which jumped 29%. The Mountain View, Calif., company said the moves, effective April 4, were made to streamline decision-making and create clearer lines of responsibility and accountability at the top of the company. Eric Schmidt will no longer be responsible for the day-to-day operations. Instead, he will become exective chairman, focusing on deals, partnerships, customers and broader business relationships. He also will continue to

executive chairman, "a lot of my time" will be devoted to dealing with regulators and other government officials, Eric Schmidt said. "We've got very complicated government issues," he said, adding that we move quickly, and we tend to be disruptive at scale. European Union officials opened a formal antitrust probe last year into Google search results, while in China the company opted to shut down its mainland search engine rather than censor results for user queries. Of Employment Agreement Microsoft CEO Steve Ballmer This apparently did not sit well with Microsoft, and a complaint was filed with the Superior Court for damages and injunctive relief. In plain violation of his employment agreement with Microsoft, Miszewski has accepted employment with Microsoft's direct competitor Salesforce.com, reads the complaint, "in a position that targets precisely the same market segment- government and public sector customers- that was Miszewski's area of responsibility while employed at Microsoft." She hired a then-unknown piano player for that engagement; a young man fresh from New Orleans named Harry Connick, Ray Charles , who later introduced her at a David Letterman Christmas party as one of the world's finest jazz singers. That four-week engagement lasted for three years for Cynthia Scott , and she decided to stay in New York. Since then, she has headlined at Birdland, Iridium, Dizzy's Club Coca Cola and many more.
